description: A Go TUI tool that auto-generates .env.example from .env with smart secret detection, and generates .env from .env.example via an interactive editable form. Supports monorepo scanning.

userStories.title: Project scaffolding and Go module setup
userStories.description: As a developer, I need the Go project structure initialized with dependencies so subsequent stories can build on it.
acceptanceCriteria: go.mod initialized with module name (e.g., github.com/user/dotenv-tui)
main.go entry point exists with a minimal Bubble Tea program that shows 'dotenv-tui' and quits on q/Ctrl+C
Directory structure created: internal/parser/, internal/scanner/, internal/detector/, internal/tui/, internal/generator/
Dependencies added: charmbracelet/bubbletea, charmbracelet/lipgloss, charmbracelet/bubbles
go build succeeds

userStories.title: .env file parser with comment and structure preservation
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a parser that reads .env files and preserves comments, blank lines, and key ordering so generated files maintain the original structure.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/parser/parser.go implements Parse(reader io.Reader) returning ordered list of entries
Each entry is one of: KeyValue (key, value, quoted style), Comment (text), BlankLine
Supports KEY=VALUE, KEY="VALUE", KEY='VALUE', and export KEY=VALUE formats
Write(writer io.Writer, entries []Entry) reproduces the original file structure
Unit tests in internal/parser/parser_test.go cover all formats, comments, blank lines, and round-trip
go build succeeds
go test ./internal/parser/ passes

userStories.title: Directory scanner for .env file discovery
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a scanner that recursively finds .env files in a project tree, skipping dependency directories.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/scanner/scanner.go implements Scan(root string) returning list of .env file paths (relative to root)
Finds files named .env, .env.local, .env.production, .env.development, and all .env.* variants, but excludes .env.example and .env.*.example
Skips directories: node_modules, .git, vendor, dist, build, .next, .nuxt, __pycache__
Unit tests in internal/scanner/scanner_test.go using a temp directory structure
go build succeeds
go test ./internal/scanner/ passes

userStories.title: Secret detection heuristics
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a detector that identifies secret-like environment variables by key name patterns and value patterns.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/detector/detector.go implements IsSecret(key string, value string) bool
Detects secret-like keys containing: SECRET, KEY, TOKEN, PASSWORD, PASS, AUTH, CREDENTIAL, PRIVATE, API_KEY, ACCESS_KEY (case-insensitive)
Detects secret-like values: base64 strings longer than 20 chars, JWT tokens starting with eyJ, URLs with ://user:pass@ pattern, hex strings longer than 32 chars
Returns false for common non-secrets like PORT, HOST, NODE_ENV, APP_NAME, DEBUG, LOG_LEVEL

GeneratePlaceholder(key string, value string) returns a format-hint placeholder preserving the value prefix (e.g., sk_*** for sk_live_abc123, ghp_*** for ghp_xxxx, eyJ*** for JWTs, https://*** for URLs). Falls back to *** for unrecognized patterns
Unit tests in internal/detector/detector_test.go with table-driven tests covering all patterns
go build succeeds
go test ./internal/detector/ passes

userStories.title: Generator logic for .env.example and .env
userStories.description: As a developer, I need generator functions that produce .env.example from .env (masking secrets) and .env from .env.example (copying with placeholders).
acceptanceCriteria: internal/generator/generator.go implements GenerateExample(entries []Entry) []Entry that replaces secret values with placeholders
internal/generator/generator.go implements GenerateEnv(entries []Entry) []Entry that copies entries as-is (for non-interactive mode)
Non-secret values are preserved as-is (e.g., PORT=3000 stays PORT=3000)
Secret values are replaced using detector.GeneratePlaceholder() which produces format-hint placeholders like sk_***, ghp_***, eyJ***
Comments and blank lines are preserved in output
Unit tests in internal/generator/generator_test.go
go build succeeds
go test ./internal/generator/ passes

userStories.title: TUI main menu with mode selection
userStories.description: As a developer, I want a main menu to choose between generating .env.example or .env so the tool is easy to navigate.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/tui/menu.go implements a Bubble Tea model with two options: 'Generate .env.example from .env' and 'Generate .env from .env.example'
Arrow key navigation highlights the selected option
Enter selects the option and transitions to the next screen (file picker placeholder for now)
q or Ctrl+C quits cleanly with alternate screen buffer restored
Styled with Lip Gloss: title, highlighted selection, help text at bottom
main.go launches this menu as the root model
go build succeeds

userStories.title: TUI file picker with scan results
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see discovered .env files in a selectable list so I can choose which files to process.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/tui/picker.go implements a Bubble Tea model showing scanned .env files as a checklist
Each item shows relative path with a checkbox (toggled with space)
Arrow keys navigate the list, Enter confirms selection
Integrates scanner.Scan() to populate the list on init
Transitions from main menu when user selects a mode
go build succeeds

userStories.title: TUI diff preview for .env.example generation
userStories.description: As a developer, I want to see a colored diff preview of what will change before writing .env.example so I can confirm the output.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/tui/preview.go implements a Bubble Tea model showing a scrollable diff view
Kept values shown in green, masked/changed values shown in yellow with old → new format
User can confirm with Enter to write the file or press Esc to cancel
After confirmation, writes .env.example using parser.Write()
Shows success message with output file path
go build succeeds

userStories.title: TUI editable form for .env generation from .env.example
userStories.description: As a developer, I want an interactive form pre-filled with example values so I can fill in my actual .env values.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/tui/form.go implements a Bubble Tea model with a scrollable list of text inputs
Each variable shows label (key name) and editable text input using bubbles textinput component
Pre-filled with example values; placeholder values (containing 'your_' or '_here') shown as empty with hint text
Tab/arrow keys navigate between fields
Enter on last field or Ctrl+S submits the form
Confirmation prompt if .env already exists before overwriting
Writes .env using parser.Write() preserving comments and structure
go build succeeds

userStories.title: CLI flags for non-interactive use
userStories.description: As a developer, I want CLI flags to run the tool non-interactively for scripting and CI use cases.
acceptanceCriteria: main.go supports --generate-example <path> flag that generates .env.example from the specified .env file and exits
main.go supports --generate-env <path> flag that copies .env.example to .env (without form) and exits
main.go supports --scan flag that lists discovered .env files to stdout and exits
main.go supports --help flag that shows usage information
When no flags provided, launches the TUI as before
go build succeeds

userStories.title: Scanner: add ScanExamples function for .env.example file discovery
userStories.description: As a developer, I need a scanner function that finds .env.example files so the GenerateEnv picker shows the correct files.
acceptanceCriteria: internal/scanner/scanner.go adds ScanExamples(root string) ([]string, error) that returns only .env.example and .env.*.example files
ScanExamples skips the same directories as Scan (node_modules, .git, vendor, dist, build, .next, .nuxt, __pycache__)
Existing Scan() function behavior is unchanged (still excludes .example files)
Unit tests in internal/scanner/scanner_test.go cover ScanExamples with temp directory structure
go test ./internal/scanner/ passes
go build succeeds

userStories.title: Picker: default to no selection and filter files by mode
userStories.description: As a user, I want the picker to start with nothing selected and only show files relevant to the chosen mode (GenerateExample shows .env files, GenerateEnv shows .env.example files).
acceptanceCriteria: NewPickerModel initializes selected map with all values set to false (none selected by default)
When mode is GenerateExample, picker calls scanner.Scan() to show .env files (current behavior)
When mode is GenerateEnv, picker calls scanner.ScanExamples() to show .env.example files
Space toggles selection on current file, 'a' toggles all files (select all / deselect all)
Enter confirms selection and sends PickerFinishedMsg with selected files
If no files selected when Enter is pressed, do nothing (don't transition)
go build succeeds

userStories.title: Picker: group files by directory with visual headers
userStories.description: As a user in a monorepo with many .env files, I want files grouped by directory with headers so I can find files quickly.
acceptanceCriteria: PickerModel uses a pickerItem struct with isHeader bool to distinguish directory headers from selectable files
Files are grouped by filepath.Dir() with a non-selectable directory header rendered above each group
Directory headers are styled differently (dimmed or bold) and cursor skips them during navigation
Files within each group are sorted alphabetically
Groups are sorted alphabetically by directory path
Space and 'a' keybindings only affect selectable file items, not headers
go build succeeds
userStories.notes: Implemented directory grouping with visual headers. Files are grouped by directory with non-selectable headers, sorted alphabetically within groups and groups sorted alphabetically by directory path.

userStories.title: Sequential file processing with Tab/Shift+Tab navigation
userStories.description: As a user, after processing one file I want to press Tab to go to the next selected file or Shift+Tab to go to the previous one, without returning to the picker.
acceptanceCriteria: main.go model struct adds fileList []string, fileIndex int, and pickerMode tui.MenuChoice fields
When PickerFinishedMsg is received, store the full selected file list and start processing fileList[0]
After PreviewFinishedMsg or FormFinishedMsg, transition to a new 'doneScreen' that shows a status bar: 'Tab: next file • Shift+Tab: prev file • q: back to menu'
Tab/Shift+Tab file navigation ONLY happens on the doneScreen, NOT during form editing (form.go already uses Tab/Shift+Tab for field navigation between text inputs)
Tab increments fileIndex and loads the next file in the same mode (preview or form)
Shift+Tab decrements fileIndex and loads the previous file
At list boundaries, Tab/Shift+Tab wraps around (last file Tab goes to first, first file Shift+Tab goes to last)
q or Esc returns to the main menu
Add doneScreen to the screen enum in main.go with its own updateDone handler
go build succeeds
userStories.notes: Implemented sequential file processing with Tab/Shift+Tab navigation. Added doneScreen with status bar, wrap-around navigation, and proper state management for fileList, fileIndex, and pickerMode.

userStories.title: Show current file path and position counter on preview/form screens
userStories.description: As a user navigating between files, I want to see which file I'm working on and my position in the list.
acceptanceCriteria: PreviewModel and FormModel accept file index and total count as init parameters
Preview screen header shows current file path and position counter (e.g., '[1/5] apps/cron/.env')
Form screen header shows current file path and position counter (e.g., '[1/5] packages/api/.env.example')
Counter updates correctly when navigating with Tab/Shift+Tab
When only one file is selected, counter shows '[1/1]'
go build succeeds
userStories.notes: Implemented file path and position counter display on both preview and form screens. Added fileIndex and totalFiles fields to models and updated View methods to show position in format '[current/total] filepath'. Counter updates correctly during Tab/Shift+Tab navigation.
